thread.title: Spirit Awards have 'Non-Memoriam' segment, because too many stars died
thread.title_full: Spirit Awards have 'Non-Memoriam' segment, because too many stars died

author: USA TODAY
title: Spirit Awards have 'Non-Memoriam' segment, because too many stars died
text:
Spirit Awards have 'Non-Memoriam' segment, because too many stars died Carly Mallenbaum , USA TODAY 10:58 p.m. ET Feb. 25, 2017 
Andy Samberg sings a parody of Pearl Jam's 'Alive' to celebrate actors who are, um, still alive. (Photo: Chris Pizzello, Chris Pizzello/Invision/AP) 
Saturday's Film Independent Spirit Awards didn't have an In Memoriam segment. Instead, they had Andy Samberg, doing his Eddie Vedder impression, sing about all of the stars who are "still alive." 
"We thought it would be more efficient to do a reel of people who did not die," John Mulaney, who hosted the award show with Nick Kroll, explained. #SpiritAwards : Andy Samberg impersonates Eddie Vedder, performs 'I'm Still Alive' during non-memoriam segment https://t.co/trYJuZy6dc pic.twitter.com/XJTftfZXm4 â€” Hollywood Reporter (@THR) February 25, 2017 
So, Samberg sang a parody of Pearl Jam's Alive and highlighted Hailee Steinfeld, Tim Allen and Craig Robinson who are still very much alive. Casey Affleck? "He just stepped outside." 
As for Fred Armisen, he staged a death during the segment. Samberg tweeted a quick eulogy during his performance. Read or Share this story: http://usat.ly/2lHRyHC Most Popular
